lessons.title: Ancient Civilizations
lessons.content: This lesson covers the major ancient civilizations, including Mesopotamia, Egypt, and the Indus Valley.
objectives: Understand the key features of ancient civilizations.
Identify the contributions of each civilization to modern society.
Discuss the cultural practices of ancient peoples.

lessons.title: The Middle Ages
lessons.content: Explore the social, political, and economic structures of the Middle Ages, including feudalism and the role of the Church.
objectives: Analyze the impact of feudalism on medieval society.
Examine the influence of the Church during the Middle Ages.
Discuss the significance of the Crusades.

lessons.title: The Renaissance
lessons.content: Learn about the Renaissance period, its key figures, and its impact on art, science, and culture.
objectives: Identify major artists and thinkers of the Renaissance.
Discuss the innovations in art and science during this period.

lessons.title: The Age of Exploration
lessons.content: This lesson focuses on the Age of Exploration, including the motivations for exploration and its consequences.
objectives: Examine the reasons behind European exploration.
Discuss the impact of exploration on indigenous populations.
Analyze the economic changes resulting from exploration.

lessons.title: The American Revolution
lessons.content: Explore the causes, key events, and outcomes of the American Revolution.
objectives: Identify the key figures in the American Revolution.
Discuss the significance of the Declaration of Independence.
Analyze the impact of the Revolution on the formation of the United States.
